employeeNumber.description: Unique identifier from HR system linking MES user to employee record
employeeNumber.businessRule: Must match active employee records in HR system for integration
employeeNumber.validation: Must be unique when not null, format validated on entry
employeeNumber.privacy: Internal employee identifier - not PII but confidential
employeeNumber.businessImpact: Incorrect mapping prevents HR integration and payroll allocation

personnelClassId.description: Links user to job classification determining access levels and capabilities
personnelClassId.businessRule: Must reference valid personnel class with current effective dates
personnelClassId.dataSource: HR system or manual assignment by administrators
personnelClassId.validation: Must exist in PersonnelClass table and be currently active
personnelClassId.businessImpact: Determines user permissions and system access levels

emergencyContact.description: Emergency contact information required for manufacturing safety compliance
emergencyContact.businessRule: Required for all personnel with shop floor access
emergencyContact.dataSource: User self-service portal or HR system
emergencyContact.format: Name and phone number in free text format
emergencyContact.businessImpact: Critical for workplace safety and emergency response

lastLoginAt.description: Timestamp of user's most recent successful authentication
lastLoginAt.businessRule: Updated automatically on each successful login
lastLoginAt.auditTrail: Tracked for security monitoring and compliance
lastLoginAt.businessImpact: Used for inactive user identification and security audits

workOrderNumber.description: Human-readable identifier for production work orders following company format
workOrderNumber.businessRule: Sequential numbering per site per year, must be unique globally
workOrderNumber.businessImpact: Primary reference for all production tracking and customer communication

priority.description: Production priority level affecting scheduling and resource allocation
priority.businessRule: Set by production planning based on customer requirements and delivery dates
priority.dataSource: Production planner assignment or ERP system import
priority.businessImpact: Drives scheduling algorithms and resource allocation decisions

estimatedCompletionDate.description: Planned completion date for work order based on scheduling algorithms
estimatedCompletionDate.businessRule: Must be future date, updated when schedule changes occur
estimatedCompletionDate.validation: Must be after start date and current date
estimatedCompletionDate.businessImpact: Used for customer delivery commitments and capacity planning

actualStartDate.description: Date when production work actually began on the shop floor
actualStartDate.businessRule: Set when first operation is started, cannot be changed once set
actualStartDate.dataSource: Shop floor data collection or operator entry
actualStartDate.auditTrail: Critical for production metrics and on-time delivery tracking
actualStartDate.businessImpact: Actual vs. planned start variance affects delivery predictions

inspectionFrequency.description: How often inspection should be performed during production
inspectionFrequency.businessRule: Determined by part criticality and customer requirements
validValues: FIRST_LAST - Inspect first and last part of lot
STATISTICAL - Sample-based inspection per sampling plan
SETUP_ONLY - Inspect only during machine setup
ON_DEMAND - Inspect when triggered by process variation
inspectionFrequency.businessImpact: Balances quality assurance with production efficiency

acceptanceCriteria.description: Specific criteria that must be met for parts to be accepted
acceptanceCriteria.businessRule: Must be measurable and verifiable by inspection personnel
acceptanceCriteria.format: JSON structure with characteristics and limits
examples: Visual: No visible defects per inspection criteria
acceptanceCriteria.businessImpact: Defines quality standards for customer acceptance

approvalRequired.description: Whether quality engineer approval is required before production
approvalRequired.businessRule: Required for critical characteristics and new part introduction
approvalRequired.businessImpact: Ensures quality oversight for critical processes

equipmentCode.description: Unique alphanumeric identifier for equipment asset tracking
equipmentCode.businessRule: Must be unique across all sites, typically includes location prefix
equipmentCode.dataSource: Asset management system or manual assignment
examples: A01-CNC-001 - CNC machine in Area A01
B02-CMM-003 - Coordinate measuring machine in Area B02
LAB-SCOPE-01 - Measurement scope in quality lab
equipmentCode.businessImpact: Primary reference for maintenance, calibration, and scheduling

calibrationDueDate.description: Next required calibration date for measurement equipment
calibrationDueDate.businessRule: Must be maintained current for measurement equipment used in quality control
calibrationDueDate.validation: Must be future date for equipment in active use
calibrationDueDate.businessImpact: Equipment cannot be used for quality measurements if calibration expired

operationalStatus.description: Current operational availability status of equipment
operationalStatus.businessRule: Updated by operators and maintenance personnel in real-time
operationalStatus.dataSource: Shop floor status updates or automated monitoring
operationalStatus.businessImpact: Critical for production scheduling and capacity planning

materialCode.description: Unique identifier for material specifications and inventory tracking
materialCode.businessRule: Must be unique globally, often follows engineering part numbering system
materialCode.format: Category-specific format (e.g., TI-6AL-4V-001 for titanium alloy)
materialCode.businessImpact: Primary reference for purchasing, inventory, and traceability

specification.description: Technical specification or standard that material must meet
specification.businessRule: Must reference valid industry or customer specification
examples: ASTM A276 - Stainless steel bar specification
specification.businessImpact: Ensures material meets required performance characteristics

certificationRequired.description: Whether material certificate is required for traceability
certificationRequired.businessRule: Required for aerospace, medical, and nuclear applications
certificationRequired.businessImpact: Determines procurement requirements and supplier qualification needs

operationNumber.description: Sequential operation identifier within a work order defining the order of manufacturing steps
operationNumber.businessRule: Must be unique within work order, typically increments by 10 (010, 020, 030) to allow insertions
operationNumber.validation: Must be numeric, unique within work order
operationNumber.businessImpact: Defines production sequence and enables proper work flow control

operationName.description: Descriptive name of the manufacturing operation for shop floor identification
operationName.businessRule: Must clearly identify the work to be performed for operator understanding
operationName.dataSource: Engineering work instructions or standard operation descriptions
operationName.businessImpact: Provides clear operation identification for scheduling and execution

estimatedDuration.description: Planned time required to complete the operation including setup and processing
estimatedDuration.businessRule: Based on time studies and includes both setup and run time
estimatedDuration.dataSource: Industrial engineering time standards or historical data
estimatedDuration.validation: Must be positive number, reasonable for operation type
estimatedDuration.businessImpact: Critical for production scheduling and capacity planning

actualStartTime.description: Timestamp when operation actually began on the shop floor
actualStartTime.businessRule: Set when operator starts work, cannot be changed once set
actualStartTime.dataSource: Shop floor data collection or operator entry
actualStartTime.auditTrail: Tracked for labor efficiency and schedule variance analysis
actualStartTime.businessImpact: Enables real-time production tracking and performance measurement

qualityPlanRequired.description: Indicates whether quality inspection is required for this operation
qualityPlanRequired.businessRule: Determined by part criticality and customer quality requirements
qualityPlanRequired.dataSource: Quality engineering assessment and quality plan definition
qualityPlanRequired.businessImpact: Ensures quality checkpoints are integrated into production flow

scheduleName.description: Human-readable identifier for the production schedule
scheduleName.businessRule: Should include time period and area/equipment group for clarity
scheduleName.dataSource: Production planning system or manual assignment
scheduleName.format: Descriptive format including location and time period
scheduleName.businessImpact: Provides clear identification for schedule communication and management

startDate.description: Start date for the scheduled production period
startDate.businessRule: Must be current or future date, defines schedule validity period
startDate.validation: Must be valid date, typically current or future
startDate.businessImpact: Defines when scheduled work should begin execution

endDate.description: End date for the scheduled production period
endDate.businessRule: Must be after start date, defines schedule completion target
endDate.businessImpact: Establishes deadline for scheduled work completion

utilizationTarget.description: Target equipment and labor utilization percentage for the schedule period
utilizationTarget.businessRule: Typically set between 70-90% to allow for flexibility and maintenance
utilizationTarget.dataSource: Production planning targets and capacity analysis
utilizationTarget.businessImpact: Balances productivity goals with operational flexibility

status.description: Current status of the production schedule in its lifecycle
status.businessRule: Status progression: DRAFT → PUBLISHED → ACTIVE → COMPLETED
validValues: DRAFT - Schedule being developed, not yet finalized
PUBLISHED - Schedule finalized and communicated to shop floor
CANCELLED - Schedule cancelled due to changes
status.businessImpact: Controls schedule visibility and execution authorization

startTime.description: Planned start time for the specific scheduled activity
startTime.businessRule: Must be within the parent schedule's date range and not overlap with other entries for same resource
startTime.validation: Must be valid timestamp, cannot overlap with other entries for same equipment
startTime.businessImpact: Defines precise timing for resource allocation and work execution

endTime.description: Planned completion time for the specific scheduled activity
endTime.businessRule: Must be after start time, duration should match operation estimates
endTime.dataSource: Calculated from start time plus estimated duration
endTime.validation: Must be after start time, reasonable duration
endTime.businessImpact: Establishes resource availability for subsequent operations

setupTime.description: Time allocated for equipment setup and changeover before operation
setupTime.businessRule: Varies by operation type and previous setup, critical for realistic scheduling
setupTime.dataSource: Time standards and setup optimization data
setupTime.businessImpact: Ensures adequate time for proper equipment preparation

status.description: Current execution status of the scheduled entry
status.businessRule: Status updates track progress from planning through completion
status.dataSource: Shop floor data collection and operator input
validValues: SCHEDULED - Planned but not yet started
READY - Prerequisites met, ready to start
CANCELLED - Entry cancelled due to changes
status.businessImpact: Enables real-time production tracking and exception management

actualDuration.description: Actual time taken to complete the scheduled activity
actualDuration.businessRule: Recorded when work is completed, used for schedule optimization
actualDuration.dataSource: Time tracking system or operator entry
actualDuration.validation: Must be positive, reasonable for operation type
actualDuration.auditTrail: Critical for continuous improvement and future scheduling accuracy
actualDuration.businessImpact: Provides feedback for improving schedule accuracy and identifying bottlenecks

enterpriseCode.description: Unique alphanumeric identifier for the enterprise following corporate naming standards
enterpriseCode.businessRule: Must be globally unique across all corporate entities and follow established naming convention
enterpriseCode.dataSource: Corporate IT during enterprise setup or acquisition integration
examples: ACME-AERO - Aerospace division of ACME Corporation
enterpriseCode.validation: Must be uppercase, alphanumeric with hyphens, 6-20 characters
enterpriseCode.businessImpact: Primary reference for all corporate reporting, financial consolidation, and regulatory filings

enterpriseName.description: Official legal name of the enterprise as registered with regulatory authorities
enterpriseName.businessRule: Must match legal corporate registration documents exactly
enterpriseName.dataSource: Legal department and corporate registration documents
enterpriseName.validation: Must match official corporate documents, required for legal compliance
enterpriseName.complianceNotes: Legal entity name required for contracts, regulatory filings, and financial reporting
enterpriseName.businessImpact: Used in all legal documents, contracts, and regulatory submissions

headquarters.description: Primary corporate headquarters location for legal and administrative purposes
headquarters.businessRule: Must reflect official corporate headquarters as filed with regulatory authorities
headquarters.dataSource: Corporate legal department and SEC filings
headquarters.complianceNotes: Required for tax jurisdiction determination and regulatory compliance
headquarters.businessImpact: Determines tax obligations, regulatory requirements, and legal jurisdiction

siteCode.description: Unique identifier for manufacturing site following corporate site naming standards
siteCode.businessRule: Must be unique globally across all enterprise sites and follow geographic naming convention
siteCode.dataSource: Corporate facilities management and site operations
siteCode.format: LOCATION-NN format where LOCATION is 3-letter city code and NN is sequential number
examples: DFW-02 - Second site in Dallas-Fort Worth area
SEA-03 - Third site in Seattle area
siteCode.validation: Must follow corporate naming standard, be unique across enterprise
siteCode.businessImpact: Primary reference for all site-specific operations, scheduling, and reporting

siteName.description: Descriptive name of the manufacturing facility for operational identification
siteName.businessRule: Should clearly identify the site's purpose and location for operational clarity
siteName.dataSource: Site operations management and facilities planning
siteName.businessImpact: Used in operational communications, shipping documents, and customer communications

location.description: Physical address or geographic location of the manufacturing site
location.businessRule: Must be accurate for shipping, logistics, and emergency response coordination
location.format: City, State/Province, Country or full street address
location.businessImpact: Critical for logistics, shipping, emergency response, and regulatory compliance

enterpriseId.description: Foreign key linking site to its parent enterprise organization
enterpriseId.businessRule: Must reference valid enterprise, cannot be changed without corporate approval
enterpriseId.dataSource: Corporate organizational structure and site ownership records
enterpriseId.validation: Must exist in Enterprise table, required for organizational hierarchy
enterpriseId.businessImpact: Defines corporate ownership and reporting hierarchy for financial and operational reporting

areaCode.description: Unique identifier for work area within the site following site area naming standards
areaCode.businessRule: Must be unique within site and follow functional area naming convention
examples: SEA-QC-01 - Quality control area in Seattle
areaCode.validation: Must be unique within site, follow naming convention
areaCode.businessImpact: Primary reference for work scheduling, resource allocation, and performance tracking

areaName.description: Descriptive name of the work area for operational identification and communication
areaName.businessRule: Should clearly describe the area's function and purpose for shop floor clarity
areaName.businessImpact: Used in work instructions, scheduling communications, and operator assignments

description.description: Detailed description of the area's purpose, capabilities, and operational characteristics
description.businessRule: Should provide sufficient detail for resource planning and capability assessment
description.dataSource: Manufacturing engineering specifications and operational documentation
examples: High-precision CNC machining for aerospace components with 5-axis capability
Clean room assembly environment for medical device final assembly
Temperature-controlled measurement lab with calibrated inspection equipment
description.businessImpact: Used for capacity planning, capability assessment, and resource allocation decisions

siteId.description: Foreign key linking area to its parent site location
siteId.businessRule: Must reference valid site, cannot be changed without manufacturing engineering approval
siteId.dataSource: Site layout planning and manufacturing engineering
siteId.validation: Must exist in Site table, required for site organizational hierarchy
siteId.businessImpact: Defines site ownership and enables site-level reporting and capacity planning

lotNumber.description: Unique identifier for a specific lot or batch of material with complete traceability
lotNumber.businessRule: Must be globally unique across all lots and follow lot numbering convention for traceability
lotNumber.dataSource: Generated by materials management system upon receipt or internal lot creation
examples: TI-240325-001 - First titanium lot received March 25, 2024
SS-240320-005 - Fifth stainless steel lot received March 20, 2024
PEEK-240315-002 - Second PEEK polymer lot received March 15, 2024
lotNumber.validation: Must be unique globally, follow format standard, cannot be changed once assigned
lotNumber.auditTrail: Critical for product traceability and recall procedures
lotNumber.businessImpact: Primary reference for all material traceability, quality control, and regulatory compliance

supplierLotNumber.description: Original lot or batch number from the material supplier for upstream traceability
supplierLotNumber.businessRule: Must match supplier certification documents exactly for traceability continuity
supplierLotNumber.dataSource: Supplier documentation, material certificates, and packing lists
examples: SUPP-TI-789456 - Supplier's internal titanium lot number
MED-CERT-456789 - Medical grade material certificate number
supplierLotNumber.validation: Must match supplier documentation, required for certified materials
supplierLotNumber.businessImpact: Enables upstream traceability to supplier source and original certifications

expirationDate.description: Date when material lot expires or becomes unsuitable for use in production
expirationDate.businessRule: Materials cannot be used after expiration date, system must enforce this restriction
expirationDate.dataSource: Supplier specifications, material certificates, and shelf-life standards
expirationDate.validation: Must be future date at time of receipt, enforced in production planning
expirationDate.complianceNotes: Critical for aerospace and medical applications where expired materials are prohibited
expirationDate.businessImpact: Prevents use of expired materials that could compromise product quality or safety

certificationLevel.description: Level of certification and compliance documentation associated with the material lot
certificationLevel.businessRule: Certification level must match or exceed requirements for intended use applications
certificationLevel.dataSource: Supplier certifications, quality management system, and regulatory requirements
validValues: AEROSPACE - AS9100 certified for aerospace applications
MEDICAL - FDA approved for medical device applications
MILITARY - MIL-SPEC certified for defense applications
certificationLevel.validation: Must be valid certification level, affects allowed usage
certificationLevel.complianceNotes: Certification level determines regulatory compliance and allowed applications
certificationLevel.businessImpact: Controls material usage based on application requirements and regulatory compliance

transactionType.description: Type of material movement or inventory transaction being recorded
transactionType.businessRule: Transaction type determines inventory impact and cost accounting treatment
transactionType.dataSource: Production control system, inventory management, and shop floor transactions
validValues: RECEIPT - Material received into inventory from supplier
ISSUE - Material issued from inventory to production
RETURN - Unused material returned to inventory from production
TRANSFER - Material moved between locations or lots
ADJUSTMENT - Inventory correction or cycle count adjustment
SCRAP - Material scrapped or written off as waste
transactionType.validation: Must be valid transaction type with proper authorization
transactionType.auditTrail: All transactions logged for financial and regulatory audit compliance
transactionType.businessImpact: Determines inventory valuation, cost allocation, and material availability

quantity.description: Amount of material involved in the transaction with appropriate units of measure
quantity.businessRule: Quantity must be positive for receipts/issues, can be negative for returns/adjustments
quantity.dataSource: Physical measurement, scale readings, or count verification
quantity.format: Decimal number with unit of measure (lbs, kg, pieces, etc.)
quantity.validation: Must be positive for normal transactions, match physical verification
quantity.businessImpact: Affects inventory levels, cost calculations, and material availability for production

unitCost.description: Cost per unit of material for the transaction used in inventory valuation
unitCost.businessRule: Unit cost must reflect actual procurement cost or standard cost as defined by policy
unitCost.dataSource: Purchase orders, supplier invoices, or standard costing system
unitCost.format: Currency amount per unit of measure
unitCost.validation: Must be reasonable for material type, requires approval for large variances
unitCost.privacy: Financial information - restricted to authorized cost accounting personnel
unitCost.businessImpact: Determines inventory valuation, cost of goods sold, and material cost allocation

authorizedBy.description: User who authorized the material transaction with appropriate permission level
authorizedBy.businessRule: Transaction authorization required based on value thresholds and transaction type
authorizedBy.dataSource: User authentication system and authorization workflow
authorizedBy.validation: Must be valid user with appropriate authorization level for transaction type
authorizedBy.auditTrail: Authorization tracked for accountability and audit compliance
authorizedBy.businessImpact: Ensures proper control over material movements and inventory changes

roleName.description: Unique name identifier for the role following corporate role naming standards
roleName.businessRule: Must be unique across the system and follow role naming convention for clarity
roleName.dataSource: Security administration and human resources role definitions
examples: QUALITY_ENGINEER - Quality control and inspection authority
roleName.validation: Must be unique, alphanumeric with underscores, all uppercase
roleName.businessImpact: Primary identifier for role-based access control and security management

description.description: Detailed description of the role's responsibilities and scope of authority
description.businessRule: Should clearly define role responsibilities for security and compliance purposes
description.dataSource: Human resources job descriptions and security policy documentation
examples: Authorized to perform production operations and data entry
Quality inspection authority with approval permissions
Equipment maintenance with safety lockout authority
description.businessImpact: Provides clear understanding of role scope for access control decisions

permissions.description: Array of permission identifiers that define what actions this role can perform
permissions.businessRule: Permissions must follow principle of least privilege and be regularly reviewed
permissions.dataSource: Security policy and role-based access control matrix
permissions.validation: All permissions must exist in Permission table
permissions.complianceNotes: Permission assignments must be auditable for SOX and security compliance
permissions.businessImpact: Determines system access levels and operational capabilities

isActive.description: Indicates whether the role is currently active and available for assignment
isActive.businessRule: Inactive roles cannot be assigned to users but existing assignments remain for audit trail
isActive.dataSource: Security administration and role lifecycle management
isActive.validation: Boolean field, defaults to true for new roles
isActive.businessImpact: Controls role availability while maintaining audit history

permissionName.description: Unique identifier for the specific system permission or access right
permissionName.businessRule: Must be unique and follow permission naming convention for consistency
permissionName.dataSource: Security policy definitions and system access control requirements
permissionName.validation: Must be unique, alphanumeric with underscores, all uppercase
permissionName.businessImpact: Granular access control for system security and compliance

resource.description: System resource or data entity that this permission controls access to
resource.businessRule: Must correspond to actual system resources and data models
resource.dataSource: System architecture and data model definitions
examples: WORK_ORDERS - Work order data and operations
QUALITY_PLANS - Quality control plans and inspections
USER_MANAGEMENT - User accounts and role assignments
resource.businessImpact: Defines scope of access control for data protection

action.description: Specific action or operation that this permission allows on the resource
action.businessRule: Actions must be clearly defined to prevent unauthorized access
action.dataSource: Security policy and functional requirement specifications
action.businessImpact: Precise control over what users can do with system resources

description.description: Human-readable description of what this permission allows users to do
description.businessRule: Should be clear enough for role administrators to make informed assignment decisions
description.dataSource: Security documentation and user training materials
examples: Allows viewing of all work order details and status information
Grants authority to approve quality inspection results
Enables creation and modification of user accounts
description.businessImpact: Facilitates proper permission assignment and security training

userId.description: Foreign key reference to the user being assigned a site-specific role
userId.businessRule: Must reference valid active user account
userId.dataSource: User management system and role assignment workflow
userId.validation: Must exist in User table, user must be active
userId.businessImpact: Links users to their site-specific access rights and responsibilities

siteId.description: Foreign key reference to the specific site where this role assignment applies
siteId.businessRule: Role assignment is site-specific to control access by location
siteId.dataSource: Site organization structure and security policies
siteId.businessImpact: Enables site-specific access control for multi-site operations

roleName.description: Name of the role being assigned to the user at this specific site
roleName.businessRule: Role must be appropriate for the site's operational requirements
roleName.dataSource: Role definitions and site-specific access requirements
roleName.validation: Must exist in Role table and be active
roleName.businessImpact: Determines user's access level and responsibilities at specific site

assignedBy.description: User who authorized and created this role assignment
assignedBy.businessRule: Assigning user must have role management permissions for the target site
assignedBy.dataSource: User management workflow and authorization system
assignedBy.validation: Must be valid user with appropriate administrative permissions
assignedBy.auditTrail: Critical for security audit and role assignment accountability
assignedBy.businessImpact: Provides accountability for role assignment decisions

assignedAt.description: Timestamp when the role assignment was created
assignedAt.businessRule: Automatically set when assignment is created, cannot be modified
assignedAt.auditTrail: Required for security audit and compliance reporting
assignedAt.businessImpact: Enables tracking of role assignment timeline for security analysis

effectiveFrom.description: Date when this role assignment becomes active and permissions are granted
effectiveFrom.businessRule: Can be future date for planned assignments, cannot be past for new assignments
effectiveFrom.dataSource: Assignment workflow and effective date specification
effectiveFrom.validation: Cannot be more than 90 days in the future
effectiveFrom.businessImpact: Enables scheduled role assignments and planned access changes

effectiveTo.description: Date when this role assignment expires and permissions are revoked
effectiveTo.businessRule: Optional for permanent assignments, required for temporary access
effectiveTo.dataSource: Assignment workflow and access duration policies
effectiveTo.validation: Must be after effectiveFrom date if specified
effectiveTo.complianceNotes: Temporary access assignments required for audit compliance
effectiveTo.businessImpact: Automatically revokes access to prevent unauthorized continued access

userId.description: User whose permissions were modified in this change event
userId.businessRule: Must reference valid user account for audit trail integrity
userId.dataSource: User management system and permission change workflow
userId.auditTrail: Critical for security audit and permission change tracking
userId.businessImpact: Identifies who was affected by permission changes

changeType.description: Type of permission change that was performed
changeType.businessRule: Must accurately reflect the nature of the permission change
changeType.dataSource: Permission management system and change workflow
validValues: GRANT - Permission was granted to user
REVOKE - Permission was removed from user
MODIFY - Permission scope or details were changed
changeType.auditTrail: Required for security compliance and access reviews
changeType.businessImpact: Enables tracking of permission lifecycle and security posture

permissionName.description: Name of the specific permission that was changed
permissionName.dataSource: Permission definitions and change management workflow
permissionName.validation: Must correspond to valid permission in system
permissionName.businessImpact: Identifies specific access right that was modified

oldValue.description: Previous permission configuration before the change
oldValue.businessRule: Must accurately capture the prior state for change tracking
oldValue.dataSource: Permission management system state before change
oldValue.format: JSON structure containing previous permission details
oldValue.auditTrail: Essential for rollback capabilities and audit compliance
oldValue.businessImpact: Enables understanding of what access was previously available

newValue.description: New permission configuration after the change
newValue.businessRule: Must accurately reflect the updated permission state
newValue.dataSource: Permission management system state after change
newValue.format: JSON structure containing updated permission details
newValue.auditTrail: Required for current state verification and audit compliance
newValue.businessImpact: Documents what access is now available to the user

changedBy.description: User who authorized and performed the permission change
changedBy.businessRule: Must have appropriate administrative permissions to make the change
changedBy.validation: Must be valid user with permission management authority
changedBy.auditTrail: Critical for accountability and security investigation
changedBy.businessImpact: Provides responsibility tracking for permission management

changeReason.description: Business justification or reason for the permission change
changeReason.businessRule: Required for significant permission changes for audit compliance
changeReason.dataSource: Change request documentation and approval workflow
examples: Security incident - access revoked pending investigation
Compliance review - access aligned with job requirements
changeReason.complianceNotes: Required documentation for SOX and security audit compliance
changeReason.businessImpact: Justifies permission changes for compliance and security review

clockInTime.description: Timestamp when the operator clocked in to start work on the assigned task or operation
clockInTime.businessRule: Must be valid timestamp, cannot be future time, creates labor time tracking record
clockInTime.dataSource: Shop floor terminals, badge scanners, or mobile time tracking applications
clockInTime.validation: Cannot be future time, must be reasonable for shift timing
clockInTime.auditTrail: Critical for labor cost tracking and compliance reporting
clockInTime.businessImpact: Determines start of billable labor time for cost accounting and payroll

clockOutTime.description: Timestamp when the operator clocked out after completing work on the assigned task
clockOutTime.businessRule: Must be after clock in time, creates completed labor time record
clockOutTime.dataSource: Shop floor terminals, badge scanners, or mobile time tracking applications
clockOutTime.validation: Must be after clockInTime, cannot be future time
clockOutTime.businessImpact: Determines end of billable labor time and calculates total work duration

laborCategory.description: Category of labor being performed for cost allocation and reporting purposes
laborCategory.businessRule: Must correspond to valid labor categories defined in cost accounting system
laborCategory.dataSource: Labor management system and cost accounting category definitions
validValues: DIRECT_LABOR - Direct production labor charged to work orders
INDIRECT_LABOR - Indirect activities like setup, cleaning, training
MAINTENANCE - Equipment maintenance and repair activities
QUALITY - Quality inspection and testing activities
SETUP - Machine setup and changeover activities
laborCategory.businessImpact: Determines how labor costs are allocated and reported for financial analysis

workOrderId.description: Foreign key reference to the work order this labor time is charged against
workOrderId.businessRule: Required for direct labor entries, optional for indirect labor activities
workOrderId.dataSource: Production planning system and work order assignment
workOrderId.validation: Must exist in WorkOrder table if specified
workOrderId.businessImpact: Links labor costs to specific production jobs for accurate costing

operationId.description: Foreign key reference to the specific operation within the work order
operationId.businessRule: Provides granular tracking of labor time by operation step
operationId.dataSource: Work order operation definitions and routing specifications
operationId.validation: Must exist in WorkOrderOperation table if specified
operationId.businessImpact: Enables detailed operation-level labor cost analysis and efficiency tracking

userId.description: Foreign key reference to the user/operator who performed the work
userId.businessRule: Must reference valid active user account for accountability
userId.dataSource: User authentication and badge scanning systems
userId.validation: Must exist in User table and user must be active
userId.businessImpact: Provides individual productivity tracking and payroll allocation

laborRate.description: Hourly labor rate applied to this time entry for cost calculation
laborRate.businessRule: Must reflect current rate structure based on operator skill level and shift
laborRate.dataSource: Human resources rate tables and labor contract specifications
laborRate.validation: Must be positive value, reasonable for labor category
laborRate.businessImpact: Determines labor cost for work order costing and financial reporting

actualHours.description: Calculated total hours worked based on clock in/out times
actualHours.businessRule: Automatically calculated from clockInTime and clockOutTime
actualHours.dataSource: System calculation based on time entry timestamps
actualHours.validation: Must be positive, reasonable for shift length
actualHours.businessImpact: Used for payroll calculation and labor efficiency analysis

siteId.description: Foreign key reference to the site where this time tracking configuration applies
siteId.businessRule: Each site can have unique time tracking rules and requirements
siteId.dataSource: Site operations management and time tracking policy
siteId.businessImpact: Enables site-specific time tracking policies for multi-site operations

requiresClockIn.description: Boolean flag indicating whether operators must clock in before starting work
requiresClockIn.businessRule: Enforces time tracking compliance based on site policy
requiresClockIn.dataSource: Site time tracking policy and labor management requirements
requiresClockIn.validation: Boolean field, affects time entry validation
requiresClockIn.businessImpact: Controls time tracking enforcement for labor cost accuracy

allowsMobileEntry.description: Boolean flag indicating whether time entries can be made from mobile devices
allowsMobileEntry.businessRule: Controls time entry methods based on site security and policy
allowsMobileEntry.dataSource: IT security policy and mobile device management
allowsMobileEntry.validation: Boolean field, affects available time entry methods
allowsMobileEntry.businessImpact: Enables flexible time tracking while maintaining security compliance

gracePeriodMinutes.description: Number of minutes allowed for late clock-in without penalty
gracePeriodMinutes.businessRule: Provides flexibility for normal operational variations
gracePeriodMinutes.dataSource: Human resources policy and labor agreement specifications
gracePeriodMinutes.businessImpact: Balances operational flexibility with time tracking accuracy

overtimeThresholdHours.description: Number of hours per day after which overtime rules apply
overtimeThresholdHours.businessRule: Must comply with labor regulations and union agreements
overtimeThresholdHours.dataSource: Labor law requirements and collective bargaining agreements
overtimeThresholdHours.complianceNotes: Must comply with Fair Labor Standards Act and local labor laws
overtimeThresholdHours.businessImpact: Determines overtime calculation for payroll and cost management

breakRules.description: JSON configuration defining break requirements and policies
breakRules.businessRule: Must comply with labor regulations for mandatory breaks
breakRules.dataSource: Labor law requirements and company break policies
breakRules.format: JSON structure with break timing and duration rules
breakRules.complianceNotes: Break policies must comply with state and federal labor regulations
breakRules.businessImpact: Ensures compliance with labor laws and maintains operator productivity

equipmentId.description: Foreign key reference to the equipment/machine for which time is being tracked
equipmentId.businessRule: Must reference valid equipment that supports time tracking
equipmentId.dataSource: Equipment management system and time tracking integration
equipmentId.businessImpact: Links machine utilization to specific equipment for efficiency analysis

startTime.description: Timestamp when the machine started operating or processing
startTime.businessRule: Automatically captured from machine control systems or manually entered
startTime.dataSource: Machine control systems, PLCs, or operator entry
startTime.validation: Cannot be future time, must be reasonable for operation
startTime.businessImpact: Tracks machine utilization for capacity planning and OEE calculation

endTime.description: Timestamp when the machine stopped operating or completed processing
endTime.businessRule: Must be after start time, indicates completion of machine cycle
endTime.dataSource: Machine control systems, PLCs, or operator entry
endTime.businessImpact: Calculates actual machine run time for efficiency and costing analysis

machineState.description: State of the machine during this time period
machineState.businessRule: Must accurately reflect machine operational status
machineState.dataSource: Machine control systems and operator status updates
validValues: SETUP - Machine being set up or changed over
IDLE - Machine available but not running
QUALITY_HOLD - Machine stopped for quality issues
machineState.businessImpact: Enables OEE calculation and downtime analysis for continuous improvement

cycleCount.description: Number of machine cycles or parts processed during this time period
cycleCount.businessRule: Must be non-negative integer representing actual production output
cycleCount.dataSource: Machine counters, sensors, or operator counting
cycleCount.format: Integer count of cycles or parts
cycleCount.validation: Must be non-negative, reasonable for time period
cycleCount.businessImpact: Measures actual production output for efficiency and capacity analysis

downtime_reason.description: Reason code for machine downtime or non-productive time
downtime_reason.businessRule: Required when machine state indicates downtime or issues
downtime_reason.dataSource: Operator entry and maintenance management system
downtime_reason.businessImpact: Identifies root causes of production losses for improvement initiatives
